messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Putting your child in public school...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/26/04 6:38:04 PM, dezigna@comcast.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/26/04 6:38:04 PM, dezigna@... writes:

<< There is a new list for just this situation started recently by another
Unschooler on AlwaysLearning:

UnschoolingSchool-subscribe@yahoogroups.com >>

I was going to find the yahoopage and add it to my other lists page
but it doesn't come up.
Anyone have the link, or is the name slight different maybe?

Sandra

messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Putting your child in public school...
messages.messageBody:
<<<Yes. My oldest has chosen to return to school. She's
not attending just yet becuase of the placement
process, but she should start sometime in the next
couple weeks.

It's her choice to go. But she knows that she can come
home at any time.>>>

There is a new list for just this situation started recently by another
Unschooler on AlwaysLearning:

UnschoolingSchool-subscribe@yahoogroups.com

I don't know how busy it is.

There is an article at www.SandraDodd.com/schoolchoice
about another family living this way that may help.

Robyn L. Coburn

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Putting your child in public school...
messages.msgSnippet: Yes. My oldest has chosen to return to school. She s not attending just yet becuase of the placement process, but she should start sometime in the next couple
messages.messageBody:
Yes. My oldest has chosen to return to school. She's
not attending just yet becuase of the placement
process, but she should start sometime in the next
couple weeks.

It's her choice to go. But she knows that she can come
home at any time.

Elizabeth, NYC
